005package edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.MathSharedStore;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUsageId;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Twist2d;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.proto.MecanumDriveKinematicsProto;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.struct.MecanumDriveKinematicsStruct;
014import edu.wpi.first.util.protobuf.ProtobufSerializable;
015import edu.wpi.first.util.struct.StructSerializable;
016import org.ejml.simple.SimpleMatrix;
017
018/**
019 * Helper class that converts a chassis velocity (dx, dy, and dtheta components) into individual
020 * wheel speeds.
021 *
022 * <p>The inverse kinematics (converting from a desired chassis velocity to individual wheel speeds)
023 * uses the relative locations of the wheels with respect to the center of rotation. The center of
024 * rotation for inverse kinematics is also variable. This means that you can set your center of
025 * rotation in a corner of the robot to perform special evasion maneuvers.
026 *
027 * <p>Forward kinematics (converting an array of wheel speeds into the overall chassis motion) is
028 * performs the exact opposite of what inverse kinematics does. Since this is an overdetermined
029 * system (more equations than variables), we use a least-squares approximation.
030 *
031 * <p>The inverse kinematics: [wheelSpeeds] = [wheelLocations] * [chassisSpeeds] We take the
032 * Moore-Penrose pseudoinverse of [wheelLocations] and then multiply by [wheelSpeeds] to get our
033 * chassis speeds.
034 *
035 * <p>Forward kinematics is also used for odometry -- determining the position of the robot on the
036 * field using encoders and a gyro.
037 */
038public class MecanumDriveKinematics
039    implements Kinematics<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds, MecanumDriveWheelPositions>,
040        ProtobufSerializable,
041        StructSerializable {
042  private final SimpleMatrix m_inverseKinematics;
043  private final SimpleMatrix m_forwardKinematics;
044
045  private final Translation2d m_frontLeftWheelMeters;
046  private final Translation2d m_frontRightWheelMeters;
047  private final Translation2d m_rearLeftWheelMeters;
048  private final Translation2d m_rearRightWheelMeters;
049
050  private Translation2d m_prevCoR = Translation2d.kZero;
051
052  /** MecanumDriveKinematics protobuf for serialization. */
053  public static final MecanumDriveKinematicsProto proto = new MecanumDriveKinematicsProto();
054
055  /** MecanumDriveKinematics struct for serialization. */
056  public static final MecanumDriveKinematicsStruct struct = new MecanumDriveKinematicsStruct();
057
058  /**
059   * Constructs a mecanum drive kinematics object.
060   *
061   * @param frontLeftWheelMeters The location of the front-left wheel relative to the physical
062   *     center of the robot.
063   * @param frontRightWheelMeters The location of the front-right wheel relative to the physical
064   *     center of the robot.
065   * @param rearLeftWheelMeters The location of the rear-left wheel relative to the physical center
066   *     of the robot.
067   * @param rearRightWheelMeters The location of the rear-right wheel relative to the physical
068   *     center of the robot.
069   */
070  public MecanumDriveKinematics(
071      Translation2d frontLeftWheelMeters,
072      Translation2d frontRightWheelMeters,
073      Translation2d rearLeftWheelMeters,
074      Translation2d rearRightWheelMeters) {
075    m_frontLeftWheelMeters = frontLeftWheelMeters;
076    m_frontRightWheelMeters = frontRightWheelMeters;
077    m_rearLeftWheelMeters = rearLeftWheelMeters;
078    m_rearRightWheelMeters = rearRightWheelMeters;
079
080    m_inverseKinematics = new SimpleMatrix(4, 3);
081
082    setInverseKinematics(
083        frontLeftWheelMeters, frontRightWheelMeters, rearLeftWheelMeters, rearRightWheelMeters);
084    m_forwardKinematics = m_inverseKinematics.pseudoInverse();
085
086    MathSharedStore.reportUsage(MathUsageId.kKinematics_MecanumDrive, 1);
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * Performs inverse kinematics to return the wheel speeds from a desired chassis velocity. This
091   * method is often used to convert joystick values into wheel speeds.
092   *
093   * <p>This function also supports variable centers of rotation. During normal operations, the
094   * center of rotation is usually the same as the physical center of the robot; therefore, the
095   * argument is defaulted to that use case. However, if you wish to change the center of rotation
096   * for evasive maneuvers, vision alignment, or for any other use case, you can do so.
097   *
098   * @param chassisSpeeds The desired chassis speed.
099   * @param centerOfRotationMeters The center of rotation. For example, if you set the center of
100   *     rotation at one corner of the robot and provide a chassis speed that only has a dtheta
101   *     component, the robot will rotate around that corner.
102   * @return The wheel speeds. Use caution because they are not normalized. Sometimes, a user input
103   *     may cause one of the wheel speeds to go above the attainable max velocity. Use the {@link
104   *     MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds#desaturate(double)} function to rectify this issue.
105   */
106  public MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds toWheelSpeeds(
107      ChassisSpeeds chassisSpeeds, Translation2d centerOfRotationMeters) {
108    // We have a new center of rotation. We need to compute the matrix again.
109    if (!centerOfRotationMeters.equals(m_prevCoR)) {
110      var fl = m_frontLeftWheelMeters.minus(centerOfRotationMeters);
111      var fr = m_frontRightWheelMeters.minus(centerOfRotationMeters);
112      var rl = m_rearLeftWheelMeters.minus(centerOfRotationMeters);
113      var rr = m_rearRightWheelMeters.minus(centerOfRotationMeters);
114
115      setInverseKinematics(fl, fr, rl, rr);
116      m_prevCoR = centerOfRotationMeters;
117    }
118
119    var chassisSpeedsVector = new SimpleMatrix(3, 1);
120    chassisSpeedsVector.setColumn(
121        0,
122        0,
123        chassisSpeeds.vxMetersPerSecond,
124        chassisSpeeds.vyMetersPerSecond,
125        chassisSpeeds.omegaRadiansPerSecond);
126
127    var wheelsVector = m_inverseKinematics.mult(chassisSpeedsVector);
128    return new MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds(
129        wheelsVector.get(0, 0),
130        wheelsVector.get(1, 0),
131        wheelsVector.get(2, 0),
132        wheelsVector.get(3, 0));
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Performs inverse kinematics. See {@link #toWheelSpeeds(ChassisSpeeds, Translation2d)} for more
137   * information.
138   *
139   * @param chassisSpeeds The desired chassis speed.
140   * @return The wheel speeds.
141   */
142  @Override
143  public MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds toWheelSpeeds(ChassisSpeeds chassisSpeeds) {
144    return toWheelSpeeds(chassisSpeeds, Translation2d.kZero);
145  }
146
147  /**
148   * Performs forward kinematics to return the resulting chassis state from the given wheel speeds.
149   * This method is often used for odometry -- determining the robot's position on the field using
150   * data from the real-world speed of each wheel on the robot.
151   *
152   * @param wheelSpeeds The current mecanum drive wheel speeds.
153   * @return The resulting chassis speed.
154   */
155  @Override
156  public ChassisSpeeds toChassisSpeeds(MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds wheelSpeeds) {
157    var wheelSpeedsVector = new SimpleMatrix(4, 1);
158    wheelSpeedsVector.setColumn(
159        0,
160        0,
161        wheelSpeeds.frontLeftMetersPerSecond,
162        wheelSpeeds.frontRightMetersPerSecond,
163        wheelSpeeds.rearLeftMetersPerSecond,
164        wheelSpeeds.rearRightMetersPerSecond);
165    var chassisSpeedsVector = m_forwardKinematics.mult(wheelSpeedsVector);
166
167    return new ChassisSpeeds(
168        chassisSpeedsVector.get(0, 0),
169        chassisSpeedsVector.get(1, 0),
170        chassisSpeedsVector.get(2, 0));
171  }
172
173  @Override
174  public Twist2d toTwist2d(MecanumDriveWheelPositions start, MecanumDriveWheelPositions end) {
175    var wheelDeltasVector = new SimpleMatrix(4, 1);
176    wheelDeltasVector.setColumn(
177        0,
178        0,
179        end.frontLeftMeters - start.frontLeftMeters,
180        end.frontRightMeters - start.frontRightMeters,
181        end.rearLeftMeters - start.rearLeftMeters,
182        end.rearRightMeters - start.rearRightMeters);
183    var twist = m_forwardKinematics.mult(wheelDeltasVector);
184    return new Twist2d(twist.get(0, 0), twist.get(1, 0), twist.get(2, 0));
185  }
186
187  /**
188   * Performs forward kinematics to return the resulting Twist2d from the given wheel deltas. This
189   * method is often used for odometry -- determining the robot's position on the field using
190   * changes in the distance driven by each wheel on the robot.
191   *
192   * @param wheelDeltas The distances driven by each wheel.
193   * @return The resulting Twist2d.
194   */
195  public Twist2d toTwist2d(MecanumDriveWheelPositions wheelDeltas) {
196    var wheelDeltasVector = new SimpleMatrix(4, 1);
197    wheelDeltasVector.setColumn(
198        0,
199        0,
200        wheelDeltas.frontLeftMeters,
201        wheelDeltas.frontRightMeters,
202        wheelDeltas.rearLeftMeters,
203        wheelDeltas.rearRightMeters);
204    var twist = m_forwardKinematics.mult(wheelDeltasVector);
205    return new Twist2d(twist.get(0, 0), twist.get(1, 0), twist.get(2, 0));
206  }
207
208  /**
209   * Construct inverse kinematics matrix from wheel locations.
210   *
211   * @param fl The location of the front-left wheel relative to the physical center of the robot.
212   * @param fr The location of the front-right wheel relative to the physical center of the robot.
213   * @param rl The location of the rear-left wheel relative to the physical center of the robot.
214   * @param rr The location of the rear-right wheel relative to the physical center of the robot.
215   */
216  private void setInverseKinematics(
217      Translation2d fl, Translation2d fr, Translation2d rl, Translation2d rr) {
218    m_inverseKinematics.setRow(0, 0, 1, -1, -(fl.getX() + fl.getY()));
219    m_inverseKinematics.setRow(1, 0, 1, 1, fr.getX() - fr.getY());
220    m_inverseKinematics.setRow(2, 0, 1, 1, rl.getX() - rl.getY());
221    m_inverseKinematics.setRow(3, 0, 1, -1, -(rr.getX() + rr.getY()));
222  }
223
224  /**
225   * Returns the front-left wheel translation.
226   *
227   * @return The front-left wheel translation.
228   */
229  public Translation2d getFrontLeft() {
230    return m_frontLeftWheelMeters;
231  }
232
233  /**
234   * Returns the front-right wheel translation.
235   *
236   * @return The front-right wheel translation.
237   */
238  public Translation2d getFrontRight() {
239    return m_frontRightWheelMeters;
240  }
241
242  /**
243   * Returns the rear-left wheel translation.
244   *
245   * @return The rear-left wheel translation.
246   */
247  public Translation2d getRearLeft() {
248    return m_rearLeftWheelMeters;
249  }
250
251  /**
252   * Returns the rear-right wheel translation.
253   *
254   * @return The rear-right wheel translation.
255   */
256  public Translation2d getRearRight() {
257    return m_rearRightWheelMeters;
258  }
259
260  @Override
261  public MecanumDriveWheelPositions copy(MecanumDriveWheelPositions positions) {
262    return new MecanumDriveWheelPositions(
263        positions.frontLeftMeters,
264        positions.frontRightMeters,
265        positions.rearLeftMeters,
266        positions.rearRightMeters);
267  }
268
269  @Override
270  public MecanumDriveWheelPositions interpolate(
271      MecanumDriveWheelPositions startValue, MecanumDriveWheelPositions endValue, double t) {
272    return new MecanumDriveWheelPositions(
273        MathUtil.interpolate(startValue.frontLeftMeters, endValue.frontLeftMeters, t),
274        MathUtil.interpolate(startValue.frontRightMeters, endValue.frontRightMeters, t),
275        MathUtil.interpolate(startValue.rearLeftMeters, endValue.rearLeftMeters, t),
276        MathUtil.interpolate(startValue.rearRightMeters, endValue.rearRightMeters, t));
277  }
278}
